availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Pemberton (Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Oldham County, Kentucky, native. Married to Queen R. Chandler Pemberton in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on May 12, 1858. Married to Martha E. Campbell Pemberton in Hopkins County on October 1, 1859. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 821.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 220A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, September 1863, p. 18.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages, p. 145-46.
"James M. Pemberton (1833-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #61444444, accessed January 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61444444.
